poem:
### On Stockpiling Rails

In the quiet yards  
of future tracks,  
steel waits in the rain,  
a testament  
to men in fear  
of stillness.  

A year's cold iron,  
rusted patience  
against the hour  
when forges fall silent,  
speaks more of the past  
than the hurried  
footfall of today.  

Below oil'd ties,  
earth keeps its secrets.
